intro: Lemna monorhiza, commonly known as the spikemoss duckweed, is a small, free-floating aquatic plant found in freshwater environments. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its simple, oval-shaped leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often submerged, followed by the development of tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Its rapid growth rate makes it an important component of aquatic ecosystems, contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms. Lemna monorhiza is also used in scientific research for studying plant physiology and environmental adaptation.
